title: Buffett Fights With Investors, With His Reputation at Risk
description: Tomorrow is Berkshire Hathaways annual shareholder meeting, the gathering known as Woodstock for capitalists. Like last year, the company is bowing to the times by holding the meeting virtually. But another aspect of the discussion may show that Warren Buffett is increasingly out of step with the times, DealBooks Michael de la Merced reports.

title: What We Know About the Deadly Stampede in Israel
description: The morning after a deadly stampede on a mountainside in Israel left at least 45 people dead and scores more injured, the authorities were investigating on Friday how a joyous religious ceremony was transformed into one of the deadliest civilian disasters in the nations history.

title: 2021 N.F.L. Draft: What to Look for on Day 2 and Day 3
description: The first round of the N.F.L. draft commands much of the attention, and rightly so.

title: Israel Mourns After a Religious Festival Turns Into Disaster
description: JERUSALEM  As Israelis mourned on Friday the 45 people trampled to death during a pilgrimage that drew tens of thousands of ultra-Orthodox Jews, questions were already arising about poor planning and possible negligence.

title: Lesson of the Day: As Covid-19 Devastates India, Deaths Go Undercounted
description: Note to teachers: This lesson draws on Times resources that contain graphic images and descriptions of death and cremation. Please preview the featured article, As Covid-19 Devastates India, Deaths Go Undercounted by Jeffrey Gettleman, Sameer Yasir, Hari Kumar and Suhasini Raj, to make sure it is appropriate for your students.

title: From dancing to business meetings, Britain tests how restriction-free events can happen safely.
description: Thousands of people letting loose on a nightclub dance floor. Hundreds of suited-up people gathering for a business conference. And none of them wearing masks.

title: Why Times Opinion Decided to Publish This Slur
description: This article also appears in the Opinion Today newsletter. You cansign up hereto receive it in your inbox each weekday morning.

title: Over 6 Years and 211 Spots, a British Man Conquers a Parking Lot
description: Michelangelo spent four years painting the ceiling of the Sistine Chapel, Tolstoy devoted six to War and Peace, and the Mughal emperor Shah Jahan took more than twice that to erect the Taj Mahal.

title: What We Learned in the 2021 N.F.L. Draft
description: The first round of the 2021 N.F.L. draft proceeded on Thursday night according to the leagues strict hierarchy: quarterbacks came first, followed by those who catch passes from them and protect them, with the defenders tasked with stopping them bringing up the rear.

title: How the N-Word Became Unsayable
description: This article contains obscenities and racial slurs, fully spelled out. Ezekiel Kweku, the Opinion politics editor, and Kathleen Kingsbury, the Opinion editor, wrote about how and why we came to the decision to publish these words in Fridays edition of the Opinion Today newsletter.

title: Renovating Your Kitchen This Summer? Proceed With Caution.
description: The salesman for the cabinets I was about to order stood in my kitchen a few weeks ago, looking worried. Normally, he would wait until after a contractor had gutted my kitchen to take final measurements, because these semi-custom cabinets ordinarily take three or four weeks to arrive. Now, because of pandemic-related delays, they would take 13 weeks, maybe more.

title: A Refugee Who Fought Back Against the Hard Right
description: GELSENKIRCHEN, Germany  The countrys largest-circulation tabloid called him the scandal asylum seeker and accused him (falsely) of entering the country illegally. People hacked his social media accounts and broadcast his location and personal information. A far-right political leader decried him as the ringleader of a violent protest, while another even suggested people like him would be a good reason to bring back the death penalty in Germany.

title: Lawyer for Navalny Is Arrested in Moscow
description: MOSCOW  The lead lawyer defending the Russian opposition leader Aleksei A. Navalny in an extremism case that could outlaw Mr. Navalnys opposition movement was arrested on Friday, the latest instance of a remarkable escalation by the Kremlin in its long-running campaign to stifle dissent.

title: Australian Politician Loses Court Fight Over Twisted Sister Song
description: An Australian politician was ordered on Friday to pay Universal Music more than $1 million for using the Twisted Sister song Were Not Gonna Take It in his partys advertising.

title: Exxon Mobil and Chevron report first quarterly profits after several losses.
description: Exxon Mobil and Chevron, the two biggest oil companies in the United States, on Friday reported their first quarterly profits after several quarters of losses, signaling that the energy industry is rebounding from the coronavirus pandemic.

title: The British Armys Legacy in Iraq and Afghanistan
description: Youre reading this weeks At War newsletter. Sign up here to get it delivered to your inbox every Friday. Email us at atwar@nytimes.com.

title: Bust of Elie Wiesel Is Added to Washington National Cathedral
description: In the western section of the Washington National Cathedral, cathedral leaders have long commemorated human rights figures. Stone carvings of Rosa Parks, Mother Teresa and other celebrated leaders grace the walls of the so-called human rights porch.

title: What to Know About Californias Drought
description: Good morning.

title: Volkswagens gag falls flat as the S.E.C. begins an inquiry.
description: Volkswagens American unit was only kidding when it put out the word late in March that it was changing its name to Voltswagen to show its commitment to electric vehicles. To say the April Fools joke didnt land is an understatement. Now the misfired marketing gag has prompted an inquiry by the Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: The True Cost of Closing the Racial Wealth Gap
description: Elimination of the wealth gap between Black and white Americans is a stated goal of President Biden and the Democratic Party. The gulf is enormous any way you look at it.

title: Its Not Just the Really Wealthy Who Face Tax Increases
description: President Biden this week proposed significant increases in taxes on the wealthy. And while the details are likely to change as the legislation makes its way through Congress, wealthy Americans were scrambling to lock in tax savings before they even knew what the proposal was.

title: Banks Were Allowed to Give People More Access to Savings in the Pandemic
description: A year ago, as the economy shut down during the pandemic and millions lost their jobs, the Federal Reserve Board changed a banking rule to give people easier access to the money in their savings accounts.

title: A Grudge Match in Japan: One Corner, Two 7-Elevens
description: HIGASHI-OSAKA, Japan  Across Japan, it can seem as if theres a 7-Eleven on every corner.

title: The Longtime Home of Gloria Gaynor Comes on the Market
description: The singer who assured us that, I Will Survive, is renovating another house in New Jersey.

title: Gloria Gaynors Contemporary House Back on the Market
description: Gloria Gaynors longtime residence, a sprawling contemporary in Green Brook, N.J., with an enclosed heated pool, a home theater and lots of closets, is back on the market. The asking price is $1.249 million.

title: Death Is the Only Truth. Watching Indias Funeral Pyres Burn.
description: NEW DELHI  The first 36 corpses were placed in the designated concrete cremation pits and set ablaze by 10 in the morning. After that, all the extra bodies went to the muddy parking lot, for a mass ceremony later.

title: Why British Police Shows Are Better
description: When you take away guns and shootings, you have more time to explore grief, guilt, and the psychological complexity of crime.

title: BAFTA Suspends Award for Actor Noel Clarke Amid Harassment Allegations
description: LONDON  The body that awards Britains equivalent of the Oscars has suspended a prominent actor and director weeks after he received one of its top awards, following accusations of sexual assault, sexual harassment and bullying from 20 women.

title: True Romance: Janet Mock on the Final Season of Pose
description: A year and a half ago, Janet Mock, a writer, director and executive producer on the FX drama Pose, began to plan a wedding. A big wedding. In a big ballroom. With music and flowers and a bride so heart-shatteringly beautiful that the groom would cry as soon as he glimpsed her at the top of the aisle.

title: Germany Sets Out Plans to Return Benin Bronzes
description: Germany will begin returning a substantial number of the priceless artifacts known as the Benin Bronzes from its museums to Nigeria next year, its culture ministry said on Thursday night.

title: The Next Reconstruction
description: The devastation of the coronavirus, and the surge in support for Black Lives Matter that followed the killing of George Floyd, have presented the United States with its best opportunity in 150 years to remake American society and belatedly fulfill its promise as a multiracial democracy.

title: Tom Clancys Without Remorse | Anatomy of a Scene
description: The director Stefano Sollima narrates a plane crash sequence in his action thriller starring Michael B. Jordan.

title: Watch Michael B. Jordan Survive a Plane Crash in Without Remorse
description: In Anatomy of a Scene, we ask directors to reveal the secrets that go into making key scenes in their movies. See new episodes in the series on Fridays. You can also watch our collection of more than 150 videos on YouTube and subscribe to our YouTube channel.

title: The World Putin Made
description: The origins of Putins worldview and the rise of Russias new ruling class

title: What to Cook This Weekend
description: Good morning. The Kentucky Derby is scheduled to run on Saturday, 6:57 p.m. Eastern time at Churchill Downs in Louisville. (Im no handicapper, but you know my moneys on Soup and Sandwich!)

title: Envisioning Better Lives for the People of Nomadland
description: To the Editor:

title: An Ode to Running in the Movies
description: What makes Harrison Ford such a great cinematic sprinter, and why does Tom Cruise always pump his arms like that?

title: When the Goals Come Out of Nowhere
description: Giorgos Giakoumakis had never scored goals. Not in great numbers, anyway. He had played 22 games, spread across three seasons, before he finally managed a single one for his first club, a team of modest ambitions and close horizons called Platanias, based on his home island, Crete.

title: The Last Creature Youd Expect Left Mysterious Trails on the Ocean Floor
description: Deep-sea sponges are not known for their mobility. After all, they lack muscles, nervous systems and organs. And forget about fins or feet for traveling the Arctic seafloor.

title: Clotilda Douglas-Yakimchuk, Pioneering Nurse, Dies at 89
description: This obituary is part of a series about people who have died in the coronavirus pandemic. Read about others here.

title: Rossini at the Drive-In, as San Francisco Opera Returns
description: SAN FRANCISCO  It feels almost too good to be true after a pandemic closure of Wagnerian scale: an audience watching a cast of singers enter the War Memorial Opera House here to rehearse and perform Rossinis classic comedy The Barber of Seville.

title: Five Horror Movies to Stream Now
description: These new horror movies offer scares from a global perspective, including an Indonesian witch, an Irish vampire, Canadian home invaders and an American family nightmare.

title: The New York Philharmonic Is Coming. In a Shipping Container.
description: Late last summer, the august New York Philharmonic took a swerve toward scrappiness.

title: Harvey Weinstein to Face Charges in Los Angeles as Early as May
description: For a year, Harvey Weinstein has been fighting attempts to extradite him from a prison near Buffalo, N.Y., to Los Angeles, a city where he was once feted as a visionary film producer and now faces multiple charges of rape and sexual assault.

title: Gnocchi, Leeks, Soupy Greens: What Else Do You Need?
description: The blooming of farmers markets in New York happens a lot later in spring than I want it to. March and April pass, and warm days eventually catch up to the chilly ones. But the stalls remain mostly populated by overwintered leeks and spinach, and last seasons potatoes, onions and apples.

title: The Best of Late Night This Week
description: This week, the late-night hosts riffed on President Bidens congressional address, the Oscars and Rudy Giuliani.

title: Tomas Estes, Who Put Tequila on a Pedestal, Dies at 75
description: Tomas Estes, who gave up a career teaching high school English to open Mexican bars and restaurants across Europe, in the process helping to transform the image of tequila from frat-house rotgut to a fine spirit that could sit on a shelf alongside cognac and single malt whisky, died on April 25 at his home in Ashland, Wash. He was 75.

title: Maryland hotel mogul continues his quest for Tribune Publishing as time runs out.
description: With time running out, Stewart W. Bainum Jr. is making a renewed effort to buy Tribune Publishing, the newspaper chain that agreed in February to sell itself to its largest shareholder, the hedge fund Alden Global Capital.

title: A Sidewalk Clock Standing Proudly in Queens Gets a Restoration
description: On a busy strip of Jamaica Avenue in Queens, where vendors hawk cellphone cases outside shops selling off-price wigs, tattoo services and fungal-nail care, stands one of downtown Jamaicas most dignified residents. This street-corner denizen is an ornate cast-iron sidewalk clock, more than a century old, attired with archaic formality like a proud codger who still wears his threadbare suit every day, even as the world passes him by.

title: The Bureaucrat From Buffalo Who Pushed Somalia to the Brink
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  During his years as an administrator at the Department of Transportation in upstate New York, the Somali refugee turned American citizen took classes in political science, imbibing democratic values he hoped to one day export back to his homeland.

title: How Big Tech Won the Pandemic
description: This article is part of the On Tech newsletter. You can sign up here to receive it weekdays.

title: National-Security Surveillance Plummeted Amid Pandemic and Russia Inquiry Fallout
description: WASHINGTON  The number of people targeted by the F.B.I. for court-approved searches and surveillance in terrorism and espionage investigations dropped sharply in 2020, a report released Friday said, amid the pandemic and the continuing political and legal fallout from the F.B.I.s botched use of its eavesdropping power in the Trump-Russia investigation.

title: Faith, Freedom, Fear: Rural Americas Covid Vaccine Skeptics
description: GREENEVILLE, Tenn. So have you gotten the vaccine yet?

title: Krugman Wonks Out: Why Doesnt Cutting Taxes on the Wealthy Work?
description: This article is a wonky edition of Paul Krugmans free newsletter. You can sign up here to receive it.

title: Billie Eilishs Portrait of Power Abuse, and 11 More New Songs
description: Every Friday, pop critics for The New York Times weigh in on the weeks most notable new songs and videos. Just want the music? Listen to the Playlist on Spotify here (or find our profile: nytimes). Like what you hear? Let us know at theplaylist@nytimes.com and sign up for our Louder newsletter, a once-a-week blast of our pop music coverage.

title: Indias Covid Crisis
description: To the Editor:

title: Al Schmitt, Maestro of Recorded Sound, Is Dead at 91
description: Al Schmitt, who as a boy watched Bing Crosby and the Andrews Sisters record music in his uncles studio, and who went on to become a Grammy Award-winning engineer for a long roster of artists including Paul McCartney, Bob Dylan, Frank Sinatra, Ray Charles and Diana Krall, died on Monday at his home in Bell Canyon, Calif. He was 91.

title: What to Know About the Census Data
description: The count reflects the slowest population growth since the 1930s. It also offers a glimpse of the shifting centers of population and power in the United States.

title: The Giants Traded Back and, Some Say, Well
description: When the Giants finally chose Kadarius Toney, a wide receiver from the University of Florida, with the 20th pick in the N.F.L. draft, the teams fans in Cleveland took a good 10 seconds to start a slow clap, mouthing undecipherable questions beneath their masks.

title: After 500 Years, an Ancient Bronze Hand Is Rejoined to a Finger
description: ROME  The Louvre Museum in Paris had a gigantic ancient bronze finger that had, at some point in time, been detached from its hand.

title: Review: Trisha Browns Dances Find a Home at Judson Church
description: The first movement is of a hand drawing a square with the thick tip of a blue marker. As that same singular hand  it belongs to the choreographer and dancer Trisha Brown  turns the square into a three-dimensional structure, she says, I imagined a cubicle form to begin with.

title: Protests Against Books by Former Trump Officials
description: To the Editor:

title: One Sons 48-Hour Fight to Save His Parents
description: After his parents fell seriously ill with Covid-19, Ajay Koli went on a desperate hunt for oxygen and medical care.

title: A Year of Cooking With My Mother
description: Let the record show that I make a terrible roommate. I can still hear my mothers voice as she encountered the sink full of dishes, the counter spilling over with spices and syrups: I cant live like this!

title: Arianna Huffington Binge-Watches TV on the Treadmill
description: With the New York charity circuit still on hiatus, here is how some philanthropists and society figures are spending their time and resources.

title: The Weekender
description: The backlash against the author Rachel Hollis. The tulips blooming in New York. Scott Rudins vengeful approach to show business. The death of the third man of the moon landing. And more.

title: Slowly, Robo-Surgeons Are Moving Toward the Operating Room
description: Sitting on a stool several feet from a long-armed robot, Dr. Danyal Fer wrapped his fingers around two metal handles near his chest.

title: Transcript: Ezra Klein Interviews Chuck Schumer
description: Every Tuesday and Friday, Ezra Klein invites you into a conversation about something that matters, like todays episode with Chuck Schumer. Listen wherever you get your podcasts.

title: You Want This Sauce
description: After packing into New York City apartments for nearly 20 years, I finally have outdoor space, and so it follows that I am finally the owner of a grill. Grilling! What a fast and delightful way to make dinner on a Wednesday! I cant say that were doing anything fancy with it, but its nice to just put some sausages or fish on there at twilight.

title: Blinken Will Visit Ukraine in Show of Support Against Russia
description: WASHINGTON  Secretary of State Antony J. Blinken will travel to Kyiv next week, a clear signal of the Biden administrations support for Ukraines government against threats from Russia.

title: Eww, Thats Gross. And We Like It That Way.
description: If the comedy Bad Trip had premiered in theaters as intended until it moved to Netflix because of the pandemic, one already notorious scene would have surely sent crowds into a frenzy of groans and laughter. It involves an encounter between Eric Andre and a gorilla best not described in a family newspaper. Skillfully paced, preposterously tasteless, its a sequence that will alienate a portion of its audience, while cementing a cult reputation with another.

title: Indoor dining in New York City will expand to 75 percent capacity next week, the governor says.
description: Restaurants in New York City can broaden indoor dining to 75 percent capacity beginning on May 7, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo said Friday, an expansion already available to restaurants in the rest of the state.
